thread.title: Generali name now in its rightful place
thread.title_full: Generali name now in its rightful place

author: ROGER CLEAVELAND REPUBLICAN-AMERICAN
title: Generali name now in its rightful place
text:
Thursday, October 22, 2015 11:04 PM EDT 
Generali name now in its rightful place BY ROGER CLEAVELAND REPUBLICAN-AMERICAN WATERBURY -- When Mario Generali walked into the Waterbury Boys Club for the first time at age 7 in 1931 to join, Norm Feitelson had already been a cash-paying member for two years at a nickel per week.Feitelson, now 91, takes great pride in how his experiences helped shape him as a kid and later as a young adult, but he admits he never met anyone who has done more with their Boys Club roots than the late Generali, who was a member, employee, program director and executive director for a total of 47 years.
